intro: Begonia calvescens, commonly known as the velvet begonia, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its velvety, dark green foliage and clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–20 centimeters and thrives in moist, well-drained soil. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant for its attractive foliage and compact growth habit. Begonia calvescens prefers partial shade and is relatively easy to care for in a home garden setting.
